summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorney Jeff Pagliuca and defense attorney Laura Menninger regarding discovery issues in the U.S. v. Maxwell case. The primary topics are technical problems with accessing thousands of photo and video files produced by the government, discrepancies in the reported number of 'Highly Confidential' nude/sexualized images (2,100 vs. ~34,000), and disputes over defense access to such material. The correspondence highlights significant challenges in evidence review and procedural disputes over discovery compliance.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Partner at Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C. representing Ghislaine Maxwell. She is corresponding with the prosecution about significant technical and procedural issues with accessing discovery materials, including thousands of images and videos.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Prosecutor for the Southern District of New York in the U.S. v. Maxwell case. He is responding to defense counsel's concerns about file accessibility and explaining the government's position on handling 'Highly Confidential' images.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Cc'd on the email chain, presumably part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case. The emails discuss the discovery materials related to her case and her ability to review evidence while at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

persons.name: Chris
persons.context: Mentioned in passing by Jeff Pagliuca in the context of a prior email exchange about partially recovered email attachments from Epstein's devices.

connections.description: Laura Menninger is the defense attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell in the criminal case.
Jeff Pagliuca is the Assistant U.S. Attorney prosecuting the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
They are opposing counsel in the U.S. v. Maxwell case, engaged in correspondence over discovery disputes.
Both are part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, as they are cc'd on the same internal emails.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Date for U.S. v. Maxwell
events.description: The trial for Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to begin on November 29, 2021, as mentioned in the email chain.

events.title: Defense Review of Evidence in New York
events.description: During the week of April 13, 2021, Laura Menninger met with prosecutors in New York to review evidence, including 'highly confidential' material on hard drives.

events.title: FBI Report on Digital Evidence
events.description: An FBI report dated January 27, 2021, indicated approximately 33,747 'Highly Confidential' images and 895 'HC' videos were identified from a digital review of CART-processed evidence from Epstein's devices.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Plaza, New York, NY 10007
500 Pearl (likely a reference to 500 Pearl Street, a federal courthouse in NYC)
Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C., 1501 10th Avenue, Denver, CO 80203
keyFacts: A significant discrepancy exists in the number of 'Highly Confidential' nude/sexualized images: the prosecution initially stated ~2,100 from Epstein's devices, but an FBI report cited ~33,747 images and 895 videos.
The defense reports major technical issues, with thousands of photo files being unreadable due to incompatible file formats and a corrupt Excel spreadsheet (SDNY_GM_00467566) containing metadata.

The prosecution is refusing to provide copies of 'Highly Confidential' images/videos to the defense, citing a Protective Order, and will only allow review under law enforcement supervision, arguing the material contains nude images of victims and third parties.

The defense argues that among the 'HC' material they reviewed, there was adult nudity but nothing they identified as child pornography, and they request access to all non-child pornography material for proper trial preparation.

The email chain reveals ongoing, contentious discovery disputes that the defense indicates may need to be raised with the Court, highlighting impediments to constitutionally guaranteed evidence review.
